normalised: telecom industry sees uptick in data plan recharges post Diwali

unnormalised: **Telecom Industry Sees Uptick in Data Plan Recharges Post Diwali**
normalised: Mumbai, november sixteen - telecommunications companies across India are reporting a significant surge in data plan recharges following the Diwali festivities. Analysts at I I F L Securities attribute this increase to heightened mobile internet usage for festive greetings, online shopping, and streaming entertainment.

unnormalised: Mumbai, Nov 16 - Telecommunications companies across India are reporting a significant surge in data plan recharges following the Diwali festivities. Analysts at IIFL Securities attribute this increase to heightened mobile internet usage for festive greetings, online shopping, and streaming entertainment.
normalised: Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio are leading the pack, offering competitive data plans starting from rupee one hundred and forty nine for one gigabyte per day. Doctor Meena Sharma, Head of Telecom Research at I I T Delhi, notes a growing trend of consumers opting for higher data allowance plans, even in rural areas.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio are leading the pack, offering competitive data plans starting from Rs. 149 for 1GB per day. Dr. Meena Sharma, Head of Telecom Research at IIT Delhi, notes a growing trend of consumers opting for higher data allowance plans, even in rural areas.
normalised: "The demand for five G enabled devices is also contributing to this upward trend," she stated. "Consumers are seeking plans that can fully leverage the capabilities of the newer technology." JioFiber is aggressively expanding its network coverage, aiming to reach an additional fifty thousand square feet by year end. This expansion includes offering bundled data and O T T subscriptions, attracting a wider customer base. The market remains highly competitive, with smaller players like Vodafone Idea also vying for market share with innovative data offerings.

unnormalised: "The demand for 5G-enabled devices is also contributing to this upward trend," she stated. "Consumers are seeking plans that can fully leverage the capabilities of the newer technology." JioFiber is aggressively expanding its network coverage, aiming to reach an additional 50,000 sq ft by year-end.
